definition: A large mass of snow and ice that suddenly slides down a mountain.
examples: The rangers closed the trail because of avalanche risk.
We saw pictures of an avalanche sweeping down the slope.

extra.memory_tip: Avalanche = a valley of snow that launches downhill.

definition: A severe snowstorm with strong winds and low visibility.
examples: The blizzard made the roads impossible to see.
We stayed indoors during the blizzard.

extra.memory_tip: Blizzard = blinding blizzardy blast of snow.

definition: A difficult task or test; to invite someone to try something difficult.
examples: Climbing the cliff was a real challenge. (noun)
She challenged herself to finish the race. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Challenge = a call to do something hard.

definition: To defeat or overcome something by effort or force.
examples: They trained to conquer their fear of heights.
The team conquered the steepest section of the route.

extra.memory_tip: Conquer = come over and take control.

definition: A narrow crack in a rock, wall, or surface.
examples: Snow filled every crevice in the cliff face.
A tiny plant grew from a crevice in the pavement.

extra.memory_tip: Crevice = a crisp, very slim slice in stone.

examples: The weather looked grim before the match.
They faced the grim facts together.

definition: Brave in a silly or risky way; not caring about danger.
examples: Going out in the blizzard was foolhardy.
A foolhardy leap nearly cost him his footing.

extra.memory_tip: Foolhardy = a foolish kind of bravery.

definition: Used temporarily when nothing better is available; a temporary substitute.
examples: They built a makeshift shelter from branches. (adjective)
The tarp served as a makeshift. (noun)

extra.memory_tip: Makeshift = what you make to shift you through.

definition: A person who expects good things to happen.
examples: The optimist in our group kept spirits high.
An optimist looks for a bright side in setbacks.

extra.memory_tip: Optimist = opts for the best outcome.

definition: Happening or existing before the one you are talking about.
examples: Our previous camp was lower on the mountain.
Check the previous page for the map key.

definition: A way from one place to another; to send or direct along a path.
examples: We chose the safest route to the summit. (noun)
They routed the hikers around the avalanche area. (verb)

definition: The highest point of a hill or mountain; to reach the highest point.
examples: Clouds hid the summit of the peak. (noun)
They planned to summit before noon. (verb)

definition: Using only a few words, sometimes unfriendly or sudden.
examples: Her reply was terse: “No.”
The notice was terse but clear.

extra.memory_tip: Terse = trimmed to the bare terms.

definition: To stop something from happening; to block or defeat a plan.
examples: Bad weather thwarted their final push.
Extra practice can thwart careless mistakes.

extra.memory_tip: Thwart = throw a wrench in it.

definition: Standing straight up and down; a line or direction that goes up and down.
examples: The cliff was nearly vertical. (adjective)
Draw a vertical through the centre. (noun)

extra.memory_tip: Vertical = like a very tall tower.

definition: A person who is harmed by an event, action, or someone else’s behaviour.
examples: Rescuers helped the storm’s victims.
The victim of the scam reported it to the police.

extra.memory_tip: Victim = the one who is affected or hurt.
